title: How to Use One Rotisserie Chicken to Make Three Meals

steps.headline: Purchase your favorite flavor of rotisserie chicken.
steps.description: Try doing something like have it for dinner the same day that you buy it with a side of broccoli and some fresh rolls. A good tip would be to cook it for an additional 45 minutes at 350 °F (177 °C) before serving - just to make sure it is fully cooked through. Take it out of the plastic pan into a covered roasting pan with a little bit of water.

steps.headline: Cut as much white meat as possible from the carcass after dinner.
Cube the meat (bite sized).
steps.description: Toss into a sandwich sized Zip-lock bag.

steps.headline: Take the rest of the carcass (skin, meat and bones).
steps.description: Toss into a gallon sized Ziploc back. Store in the fridge.

methods.name: Tomato curried chicken with whole wheat flat bread ("roti") using cubed white meat.

steps.headline: Throw in the chicken, 2-3 oz of tomato paste, 2 fresh chopped tomatoes and 1 tsp salt in a medium sized stock pot.
Grind  1/2 onion (any kind), 2 - 3 cloves of garlic, coriander seeds, and a small piece of ginger and a small amount of water to puree consistency and toss in the pot.
Stir while heating on high heat.
steps.description: When mixture is bubbling, reduce to med / med-high.

steps.headline: Serve with roti and sliced cucumbers.

methods.name: Chicken Biryani - using the chicken carcass

steps.headline: Put the  chicken carcass (all of it) in a crock pot, together with 1 tsp sea salt, 3 bay leaves, 2 cinnamon sticks, 3 cardamom pods and 4 whole cloves.
Leave on high for 3 hours.
steps.description: About 45 minutes before you are going to have dinner, finely chop 2 potatoes and some carrots.

steps.headline: Remove the carcass from the crock pot.
Toss the skin, bones and fatty parts - the meat will fall right of the bones.
Combine vegetables, 1 cup of Basmati rice, chicken meat and the chicken stock (water) from your crock pot in a large pot.
Boil for 35 minutes,start on high and stir often.
steps.description: If needed add more water. If you run out of the chicken stock, just use plain water.

steps.headline: Reduce heat after 15 minutes to medium.
Cover the pot (make sure the lid fits) when almost all of the water has been absorbed, turn the stove off and leave the pot on the stove for another 10 minutes.

text: Steps Purchase your favorite flavor of rotisserie chicken. Try doing something like have it for dinner the same day that you buy it with a side of broccoli and some fresh rolls. A good tip would be to cook it for an additional 45 minutes at 350 °F (177 °C) before serving - just to make sure it is fully cooked through. Take it out of the plastic pan into a covered roasting pan with a little bit of water. Cut as much white meat as possible from the carcass after dinner.  Cube the meat (bite sized). Toss into a sandwich sized Zip-lock bag. Take the rest of the carcass (skin, meat and bones). Toss into a gallon sized Ziploc back. Store in the fridge. Tomato curried chicken with whole wheat flat bread ("roti") using cubed white meat. Throw in the chicken, 2-3 oz of tomato paste, 2 fresh chopped tomatoes and 1 tsp salt in a medium sized stock pot.  Grind  1/2 onion (any kind), 2 - 3 cloves of garlic, coriander seeds, and a small piece of ginger and a small amount of water to puree consistency and toss in the pot.  Stir while heating on high heat. When mixture is bubbling, reduce to med / med-high. Let simmer for 40 minutes.  Serve with roti and sliced cucumbers.  Chicken Biryani - using the chicken carcass Put the  chicken carcass (all of it) in a crock pot, together with 1 tsp sea salt, 3 bay leaves, 2 cinnamon sticks, 3 cardamom pods and 4 whole cloves.  Leave on high for 3 hours. About 45 minutes before you are going to have dinner, finely chop 2 potatoes and some carrots. Remove the carcass from the crock pot.  Toss the skin, bones and fatty parts - the meat will fall right of the bones.  Combine vegetables, 1 cup of Basmati rice, chicken meat and the chicken stock (water) from your crock pot in a large pot.  Boil for 35 minutes,start on high and stir often. If needed add more water. If you run out of the chicken stock, just use plain water. Reduce heat after 15 minutes to medium.  Cover the pot (make sure the lid fits) when almost all of the water has been absorbed, turn the stove off and leave the pot on the stove for another 10 minutes.  Serve with yogurt.
